com.bham.bd.audio

Class AudioManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.audio.AudioManager

  • public class AudioManager
extends Object

    Manages all audio in the game

    This class is used to play sound effects, load any songs to play them in parallel or sequentially, pause and stop any currently playing music. This class uses two helper classes: ParallelAudioPlayer and SequentialAudioPlayer which have protected access within the package. No other cass except for this should have access to them. This is to ensure they are instantiated correctly and this class handles that.

    Note: this class can also play parallel batches of songs sequentially but it is never the case we'd want to play sequential batches of songs in parallel, therefore this class does not support that.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AudioManager()
      Constructs audio manager and sets initial music volume to 30% and initial effects volume to 70%

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        protected AudioPlayer getPlayer()
        Gets the sequential or parallel player audio manager uses

        Note: classes outside audio package cannot access it - it is mainly used for testing

        Returns:
        currently used AudioPlayer or null if it is not loaded

      • createSFX

        private EnumMap<SoundEffect,AudioClip> createSFX()
        Creates an enum set of audio clips

        Maps all values of SoundEffect to corresponding audio files acquired by enum's createAudio() method. If that method fails to create an audio clip, the set simply skips it.

        Returns:
        an EnumMap of sound effects as keys and audio clips as values

      • createTracks

        private ArrayList<Media> createTracks(SoundTrack[] soundTracks)
        Creates media files from a given sound track array

        Goes through each enum value (if any) in the provided array and maps them to corresponding audio files acquired by enum's createAudio() method. If that method fails to create a media file, the list simply skips it.

        Parameters:
        soundTracks - array of SoundTrack values to be converted to media files
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of sound tracks as media objects

      • loadSequence

        private void loadSequence(boolean loop,
                          List<AudioPlayer> players)
        Prepares to play a list of audio players in sequence with a possibility to loop indefinitely
        Parameters:
        loop - true or false indicating if the player should start over if it has finished
        players - list of players that will be put in a sequential loop

      • loadSequentialPlayer

        public void loadSequentialPlayer(boolean loop,
                                 SoundTrack... soundTracks)
        Prepares to play the provided tracks sequentially
        Parameters:
        loop - true or false indicating if the player should start over if it has finished
        soundTracks - enum values to be converted to media files

      • loadSequentialPlayer

        public void loadSequentialPlayer(boolean loop,
                                 SoundTrack[]... soundTrackBatches)
        Prepares to play given batches (each song in a batch is played in parallel) in sequence

        Note: as this method overloads loadSequentialPlayer(boolean, SoundTrack...), if we want to create just one batch in a sequence, we would need to pass in an extra empty array. This is redundant, instead we should use a method loadParallelPlayer(boolean, SoundTrack...) specifically for just one batch.

        Parameters:
        loop - true or false indicating if the sequence should start playing again after it ended
        soundTrackBatches - arrays of sound tracks to be played one by one (when one bach of tracks ends playing, another starts)

      • loadParallelPlayer

        public void loadParallelPlayer(boolean loop,
                               SoundTrack... soundTracks)
        Prepares to play the provided tracks in parallel
        Parameters:
        loop - true or false indicating if the player should start over if it has finished
        soundTracks - enum values to be converted to media files

      • playEffect

        public void playEffect(SoundEffect effect)
        Plays a sound effect if it is contained in the SFX set
        Parameters:
        effect - type of SoundEffect to be played

      • playMusic

        public void playMusic()
        Plays the current player if it is set up

        public void pauseMusic()
        Pauses the current player if it is set up

      • stopMusic

        public void stopMusic()
        Stops the current player if it is set up

      • setMusicVolume

        public void setMusicVolume(double volume)
        Sets volume for the current player on a new thread to interfere less with the running thread
        Parameters:
        volume - value between 0 and 1 indicating a new balance of the current player

      • setEffectsVolume

        public void setEffectsVolume(double volume)
        Sets volume for every sound effect on a new thread to interfere less with the running thread
        Parameters:
        volume - value between 0 and 1 indicating a new balance of each sound effect

      • getMusicVolume

        public double getMusicVolume()
        Gets the current music volume
        Returns:
        value between 0 and 1 indicating the current volume of the player

      • getEffectsVolume

        public double getEffectsVolume()
        Gets the current effects volume
        Returns:
        value between 0 and 1 indicating the current volume of the effects
